Opium.name: Opium
Opium.description: A relatively mild opioid obtained from Aquatic Poppy. Most commonly used to manufacture morphine and fentanyl.

Antibiotics.name: Broad-spectrum Antibiotics
Antibiotics.description: A mild antibiotic that acts against a wide range of disease-causing bacteria, though with side effect of internal damage. Used as an ingredient in many medical compounds.

Stabilozine.name: Stabilozine
Stabilozine.description: Used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. On its own, can be mildly useful in the treatment of internal damage and burns, and slightly more effectively for oxygen deprivation.

Ethanol.name: Ethanol
Ethanol.description: Medical alcohol used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. Drinking while on duty is not advised.

SulphuricAcid.name: Sulphuric Acid
SulphuricAcid.description: A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Used as an ingredient in several poisons.

Bandage.name: Bandage
Bandage.description: Basic bandages, useful in the treatment of bleeding wounds and burns.

Plastiseal.name: Plastiseal
Plastiseal.description: A synthetic skin with hemostatic properties, able to quickly seal most wounds.

AntibioticGlue.name: Antibiotic Glue
AntibioticGlue.description: An antibiotic glue with hemostatic properties. Seals bleeding wounds almost immediately and treats burns very effectively. Use with care as it may cause mobile clots in the bloodstream.

Morphine.name: Morphine
Morphine.description: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.

Fentanyl.name: Fentanyl
Fentanyl.description: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.

Saline.name: Saline
Saline.description: A sodium chloride infusion mildly useful in the treatment of blood loss.

BloodPack.name: Blood Pack
BloodPack.description: A pack of blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.

Deusizine.name: Deusizine
Deusizine.description: A highly potent stimulant effective in the treatment of internal damage, oxygen deprivation and to a lesser extent, blood loss. Produces mild burns as a side effect.

Calyxanide.name: Calyxanide
Calyxanide.description: An antiparasitic drug used in the treatment of husk parasite infections. Might require higher dosage to cure the infection at later stages.

Naloxone.name: Naloxone
Naloxone.description: An opioid antagonist for the treatment of opiate based withdrawal and overdose.

MorbusineAntidote.name: Morbusine Antidote
MorbusineAntidote.description: An antidote for acute morbusine poisoning.

LiquidOxygenite.name: Liquid Oxygenite
LiquidOxygenite.description: A mildy toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream when injected. Avoid dropping.

TonicLiquid.name: Tonic Liquid
TonicLiquid.description: A medical solution that's mildy effective as a treatment for internal damage, but most commonly used as an ingredient in more complex medical compounds.

AnabolicSteroids.name: Anabolic Steroids
AnabolicSteroids.description: Temporarily increases muscular strength and physical performance.

Hyperzine.name: Hyperzine
Hyperzine.description: An extremely potent muscle stimulant for those moments when you gotta go fast.

ChloralHydrate.name: Chloral Hydrate
ChloralHydrate.description: A sedative that can be used to knock someone out for a short period of time.
